article.title: Topological semimetals studied by ab initio calculations

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following types of topological semimetals features a band gap closing along a loop in k-space?
In a system with inversion symmetry but without time-reversal symmetry, how are the monopole charges of Weyl nodes distributed in k-space?
choices: They don\'t exist in such systems

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of phase transition in inversion-asymmetric systems is ALWAYS accompanied by a Weyl semimetal phase?
choices: Transitions between phases with different Z2 topological numbers
Transitions between phases with the same Z2 topological numbers
Transitions between metallic and insulating phases

multiple_choice_question.text: In Figure 4(c), what symmetry protects the degeneracy of the Weyl nodes along their trajectory?
What happens to the band gap of LuSI when pressure is applied?
choices: It closes and the system becomes a Weyl semimetal
It closes and the system becomes a Dirac semimetal

multiple_choice_question.text: What topological feature emerges in Te at a pressure range of 2.17â€“2.19 GPa?
What happens to the nodal lines in HfS under high pressure (above 9 GPa)?
choices: They shrink to points and a gap opens
They merge into a single nodal point

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the characteristic feature of surface states in a nodal-line semimetal?
choices: They form Fermi arcs connecting Weyl nodes
They form flat bands within the entire surface Brillouin zone
They form drumhead surface states within the region surrounded by the projected nodal line
They don\'t exist in nodal-line semimetals

multiple_choice_question.text: What happens to the electronic structure of Ca under pressure?
What type of symmetry breaking can induce a transition from a nodal-line semimetal to a Weyl semimetal?
